Barbara Lee's stand was not just symbolism. The AUMF she opposed granted sweeping powers to the executive branch to wage war, usurping the role of Congress delineated in the Constitution. These powers have been abused by multiple presidents.
She knew that opposing the Bush administration‚Äòs endless wars in Afghanistan and Iraq would come at a cost. It did. She was vilified. She faced death threats. But in the end, she was vindicated.

It takes a special person, a true leader, to stand up for what is right when every single one of your colleagues in Congress is sitting down. That is who Barbara Lee is. We need leaders like that in the Senate.
